results.title: Taupo holiday
results.brief_description: Tourist promotion film of activities on and around Lake Taupo, New Zealand. Featured items include: Spa Hotel; Waikato River; Wairaki Valley and thermal activity; fishing for rainbow trout.

results.title: Taronga
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Collings and Taronga Zoological Park Trust
results.brief_description: Taronga, which is an aboriginal name for beautiful view, is the home of the extensive collection of animals and birds of the Zoological Trust on the North Shore of Sydney Harbour. The film follows a party of children on their tour of the grounds and shows koalas, emus, kangaroos and Australian birds as well as the larger animals from overseas. Amusements available to the children include being allowed to hold and feed baby animals in the nursery and to go for rides on elephants and miniature trains.

results.title: Taliesin East
results.creator_credit: James Davis, Wynant D Vanderpool and A.F. Films
results.brief_description: American architect, Frank Lloyd Wright had two homes. Talisen East, near Madison, Wisconsin and Taliesen West, near Phoenix Arizona. These homes illustrate Wright’s fundamental architectural principle, that buildings must blend with and seem to grow from their natural settings. Both structures reveal a conscious return to nature as inspiration for their design. ‘Awareness of environment’ says Wright ‘permits sustained original creation’. Taliesen East is a graceful structure, predominently in wood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Davis, Wynant D Vanderpool and A.F. Films

results.title: Talent auction
results.creator_credit: Milton Schwarzwald, Frank Jessop and Nu-Atlas Productions
results.brief_description: An auctioneer auctions off a variety of entertainers including singers, dancers and musicians. Features Irene Beasely, The Mercy Macs, The Five Reillys, Paul Robinson, Bobby Bernard. Orchestra conducted by Josef Gershenson.

results.title: Taking care of yourself: breast self-examination
results.creator_credit: Instant Replay Productions, New South Wales Cancer Council and Westmead Hospital
results.brief_description: Most women take care of their bodies, however very few of them check their breasts as often as they should. This program explains the importance of regular breast self-examination, and provides a step-by-step guide for carrying out effective examinations. It also provides guidelines on what to look out for when carrying out breast self-examination.

results.title: Taijiquan (Tai Chi): the 24 forms
results.creator_credit: Michael Ngai and East Acton Videos
results.brief_description: Tai Chi is a simple and powerfully effective art form, proven by clinical studies to help relax and yet strengthen both body and mind. Being the most popular Forms in the world today, the 24 Forms is considered to be perfectly suitable for students of almost any level of physical fitness and age. Features step by step teaching with precise and easy to follow instructions suitable for all levels of learning, 6 Qigong excerises, 7 single movements and demonstrations by medal winning instructors from Health Tai Chi Chuan.

results.title: T.V. commercials: Shell trio
results.brief_description: A series of three commercials which established the “Go Well - Go Shell” theme for one year. The three commercials vary in mood and approach. Individual titles are “Theme”, “Rain” and “Coast road”.

results.title: T.V. commercials: four types
results.brief_description: A series of commercials using different approaches: hard sell, with emphasis on product and brand name; hard sell message with soft sell approach; soft sell, in which the emphasis is not solely on the product; and the testimonial technique for viewer identification. Products featured: Tarax, ANZ Christmas Club, ANZ Travel, Export Action, ANZ Cheque Account, Sidchrome.
